content.description: This is a two pitch route, put up in the winter. The first pitch is the crux, where fun moves take you over the roof. The second pitch angles up to the right. The first set of anchors provides a nice spot to belay for the second pitch.
content.protection: P1 is 5.10a and has 11 bolts. P2 is 5.9 and has 9 bolts.
content.location: The route is on the left side of the trough on the West side of the rock.

content.description: This route is long (40m). The first half climbs through an enjoyable water runnel and brings you to a halfway anchor under a roof. This is where the business starts. It has fun, steep climbing with a few cruxes including an awesome finger lock to pull the last bulge!
content.protection: 17 quickdraws and an 80m rope (pitch it out or rethread the midway anchor with a 60m rope).
content.location:
This goes right up the middle of the lefty wall to shares an anchor with

Winter Surprise

.

content.description: Scramble up on easy rock, about 15 feet up to belay from cold shuts. The route is 100 feet long when belaying from this anchor. It has good, solid rock.
content.location: It is the furthest bolted route to the right on this wall. There is one trad line to the right of this route. Begin up a sloped ledge.

content.description: This is another great link-up for a long 40m pitch. A typical Manassa slab brings you up the series of roof cruxes. Pull the first obvious roof to a good rest and then more challenging steep climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: Quickdraws. It is an 80m rope route.
content.location:
It is on the right side of the alcove where

Winter Surprise

is located.

content.description: One looks at this route and "says no way is it 5.8". If it wasn't for the leaning block at the roof, it would be a lot harder. Because it's only 5.8, it could be a good first multi-pitch route. It has a good belay ledge atop the first pitch.
content.protection: The first pitch has 11 bolts and an anchor. The second pitch has 4 bolts and an anchor.
content.location: The route starts on a ramp just left of the white water streak and climbs the roofy section on a large block. The second pitch climbs low angle slab. From the top, it's easiest to rappel the route.
